page.title: 02The Village of Calbourne
page.content: There has been a village in {Calbourne}for over a thousand years. The present village is one of the few in Britain that still exists in its {traditional}form. This fact generates considerable outside interest in the area. Much of the non-agricultural business is therefore related to the seasonal{tourist trade.} The main attraction for visitors is the quaint old street known locally as{Winkle Street.}A stream, the{Caul {Bourne,}runs the full length of the street of mainly thatched cottages. Most of the village is within a carefully controlled{Conservation {Area.}Although conserved externally most of the houses have been modernised internally, including the installation of 'indoor plumbing.' In many cases the work has been carried out by the local builders, Brett Bros.
